conditions.name: Dose Titration Safety Review
conditions.description: Safety data must be reviewed by the Safety Review Committee before dose titration.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The outpatient period can be extended with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: ALT or AST Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to moderate liver enzyme elevation.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN

conditions.name: ALT or AST Elevation (High)
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to high liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a significant decrease in hemoglobin.

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a significant decrease in platelets.

conditions.name: Bilirubin Elevation with ALT Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to concurrent bilirubin and ALT elevation.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for evaluating dose modification due to neurological worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Dosing Fasting Requirement
conditions.text: study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours)

conditions.name: Post-Dose Meal Delay
conditions.description: Condition for meals after study intervention administration.
conditions.text: meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, reduce dose to previous dose level.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematology
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin > 2 g/dL ↓ from baseline OR Platelets > 30% ↓ from baseline, reduce dose to previous dose level.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurological Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a severe uncontrolled infection occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Post-Study Therapy Transition
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods of the study (ie, Day 40), participants will transition to therapy that was discontinued before enrollment, or transition to other standard of care therapy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for titrating dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on safety review through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Event-driven decision point to modify, interrupt, or discontinue dose based on safety parameters (liver function, hematology, neurological status).
